Sentencas: The degradation mechanism of anode-supported planar solid oxide fuel cells is investigated in the present work.
Titulo: Degradation Mechanism of Anode-Supported Solid Oxide Fuel Cell In Planar-Cell Channel-Type Setup

Sentencas: We fabricate a large-area (10cmx10cm) cell and carry out a long-term test with the assembly components.
Titulo: Degradation Mechanism of Anode-Supported Solid Oxide Fuel Cell In Planar-Cell Channel-Type Setup

Sentencas: A constant current of approximate to 0.4Acm(-2) is applied to the cell for approximate to 3,100h, and the furnace temperature is controlled in the sequence 750-800-750 degrees C to investigate the effect of operating temperature and thermal cycling on the degradation rate.
Titulo: Degradation Mechanism of Anode-Supported Solid Oxide Fuel Cell In Planar-Cell Channel-Type Setup

Sentencas: Impedance spectra and current-voltage characteristics are measured during the operation in order to trace any increase in Ohmic and non-Ohmic resistance as a function of time.
Titulo: Degradation Mechanism of Anode-Supported Solid Oxide Fuel Cell In Planar-Cell Channel-Type Setup

Sentencas: The degradation rate is rapid during the operation at the higher temperature of approximate to 800 degrees C compared to that during the operation at approximate to 750 degrees C. Even after cooling down to approximate to 750 degrees C, that rate is still accelerated.
Titulo: Degradation Mechanism of Anode-Supported Solid Oxide Fuel Cell In Planar-Cell Channel-Type Setup

Sentencas: The main contribution to the cell degradation is from an increase in the Ohmic resistance.
Titulo: Degradation Mechanism of Anode-Supported Solid Oxide Fuel Cell In Planar-Cell Channel-Type Setup

Sentencas: Postmaterial analyses indicate that the cathode is delaminated at the electrolyte/cathode interface, which is attributed to the difference in thermal expansion coefficient (TEC).
Titulo: Degradation Mechanism of Anode-Supported Solid Oxide Fuel Cell In Planar-Cell Channel-Type Setup

Sentencas: Thus, the present results emphasize the importance of matching the TEC between cell layers, especially under severe operating conditions such as long duration and complex thermal cycling.
Titulo: Degradation Mechanism of Anode-Supported Solid Oxide Fuel Cell In Planar-Cell Channel-Type Setup
